q: concern. I regret the remark which I consider inappropriate," Sergio Marchionne said in his statement. Some suggested his comments showed a lack of gratitude for the government's decision to save Chrysler. I have repeated on numerous occasions, on behalf of all the people at Chrysler, our gratitude to the U.S. and Canadian governments for the financial assistance that was critical to the recovery of our Group, he said. account on Thursday, Eric Schmidt wrote: "Day-to-day adult supervision is no longer needed." "I believe Larry Page is ready" to take over as CEO, Eric Schmidt said during a call with analysts. It's time for him to have a shot at running this. In recent months, Eric Schmidt had assumed more of an ambassador role for Google, which is under heavy scrutiny from regulators in the United States and abroad and faces growing questions about its ability to innovate and

"By clarifying our individual roles, we'll create clearer responsibility and accountability at the top of the company. In my clear opinion, Larry Page is ready to lead." Larry Page said Eric Schmidt had done an outstanding job leading Google for the last decade. The results speak for themselves. The news surprised and worried Google observers. "The executive change is very much unexpected, and somewhat of a concern to investors," said Clayton Moran, an analyst at Benchmark Co..
